xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: The specific type of node in the A&AI graph

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: The URL to the specific resource

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Ignore the RESTCONF paths for this. It will be aai/{version}/actions/update only.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Complex housing an LCP instance. In 1504, this data comes from RCT in a file processed on a schedule defined in crontab. A&AI has code to parse the file and take action on the graph using our REST APIs.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique identifier for physical location, e.g., CLLI

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Data center code which can be an alternate way to identify a complex

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Gamma complex name for LCP instance.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Type, e.g., central office, data center.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: A keyword provided by A&AI to indicate type of node.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: URL to the object in A&AI.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: A keyword provided by A&AI to indicate an attribute.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Value of the attribute.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: The Target provider edge router

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Name of the availability zone

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Comma separated list of ctags

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: OpenStack tenant. In 1504, RO will PUT the tenant to A&AI. Relationship list is used to link to service-subscription.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique id relative to the platform, assuming unique across AT&T for now

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Readable name of tenant

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Relationship-list must include related to of service-subscription and keys for global-customer-id and service-type.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Virtual Server, with its ipaddresses and block storage volumes. In 1504, this REST interface is unused. Instead, the hand coded vserver REST API from Trinity was modified to take the relationship list structure. In 1507, we hope to negotiate with RO to change to use our Yang-driven vserver, image, flavor, etc. Relationship list is used to link to VNF (vce and generic-vnf, etc.).

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique identifier for this vserver relative to its tenant

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Name of vserver

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Alternative name of vserver

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Trigger for operational monitoring of this resource by Service Assurance systems.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: URL that points to source of truth for this resource

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: E.g., CUSTOMER, UPLINK, etc.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Questionably placed - v6 ip addr of this interface (is in vr-lan-interface from Mary B.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Indicator of fixed or floating address

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Indicator of fixed or floating address

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Block storage volume. In 1504, RO is expected to send this to A&AI.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique ID of block storage volume relative to the vserver.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: URL to block storage volume in source of truth

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Openstack flavor. In 1504, this REST interface is unused. The data is populated by RO through the hand-coded vserver interface rather than through its own REST API. Expect this to change when we can negotiate with RO to PUT this data or we change our code to trigger a dispatcher job to go get flavor if it is missing when RO PUTs a vserver.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Flavor id, expected to be unique across A&AI.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Flavor name

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Number of CPUs

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Amount of memory

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Disk space

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Amount of ephemeral disk space

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: amount of swap space allocation

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: whether flavor is available to all users or private to the tenant it was created in.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Link provided by source of truth to get more details.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Boolean as to whether this flavor is no longer enabled

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Openstack image. In 1504, this REST interface is unused. The image data is populated by RO through the hand-coded vserver interface rather than through its own REST API. Expect this to change when we can negotiate with RO to PUT this data or we change our code to trigger a dispatcher job to go get image if it is missing when RO PUTs a vserver.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Image id, expected to be unique across A&AI

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Image name

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Operating system architecture.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: The common name of the operating system distribution in lowercase

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: The operating system version as specified by the distributor.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: The application that the image instantiates.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: The vendor of the application.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: The version of the application.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Link provided by source of truth to get more details.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Metadata must include application, application-vendor, and application-version

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Digital Virtual Switch/Virtual Digital Switch container for switch name and vcenter URL, used by SDN-C to configure VCEs. In 1504, A&AI needs to receive this data from the PO deployment team and administer it using the provisioningTool.sh into A&AI. Relationship list is used to link to availability-zone.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: DVS switch name

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: URL used to reach the vcenter

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Compute node. In 1504, this data comes from RCT in a file processed on a schedule defined in crontab. A&AI has code to parse the file and take action on the graph using our REST APIs. Relationship-list is used to link to complex.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Value from executing hostname on the compute node.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: PTNII name

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Number of cpus

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Disk size, in GBs

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: RAM size, in MBs

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Equipment type. Source of truth should define valid values.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Equipment vendor. Source of truth should define valid values.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Equipment model. Source of truth should define valid values.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Fully-qualified domain name

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Link provided by source of truth to get more details.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Used to configure device, also used for troubleshooting and is IP used for traps generated by device.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Relationship list must contain related-to of complex with key data of physical-location-id

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Captures the numeric part of the speed

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Captures the units corresponding to the speed

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Defines the OAM network. In 1504, A&AI expects RO to put all attributes but the ones related to ipv4-oam-gateway-address and prefix. Those need to be hand administered by A&AI through the provisioningTool.sh. Relationship list is used to link to service-capability and complex.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: UUID of the network. Unique across A&AI.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Name of the network.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Used for VNF firewall rule so customer cannot send customer traffic over this oam network

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Used for VNF firewall rule so customer cannot send customer traffic over this oam network

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Relationship list must contain related-to of service-capability with key data service-type and vnf-type and related-to of complex with key data of physical-location-id

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Availability zones group physical servers. In 1504, A&AI expects to receive all attributes from RO through REST. Relationship list is used to link to service-capability and complex.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Name of the availability zone. Unique across A&AI for all services.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Type of hypervisor. Source of truth should define valid values.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: State that indicates whether the availability zone should be used, etc. Source of truth should define valid values.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Relationship list must contain related-to of service-capability with key data service-type and vnf-type and related-to of complex with key data of physical-location-id

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Virtual organization of cloud infrastructure elements in a data center context

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique ID of the vdc

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Name of the virtual data center

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Virtual organization of cloud infrastructure elements in a data center context

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Global customer id used across ECOMP to uniquely identify customer.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Subscriber name, an alternate way to retrieve a customer.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Value defined by orchestration to identify this service across ECOMP.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Relationship-list used to link to cvlantag and vce.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Corresponds to a customer endpoint for the parent service-subscription.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: This gets defined by others to provide a unique ID for the service, we accept what is sent.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: This gets defined by others to provide a unique ID for the VNF type, we accept what is sent.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: e.g., evc-name, or vnf-nameA_interface-nameA_vnf-nameZ_interface-nameZ

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Type of logical link, e.g., evc

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Captures the numeric part of the speed

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Captures the units corresponding to the speed

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: v4, v6, or ds for dual stack (should be att-ip-version)

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: For example, static or BGP

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Logical links can connect l-interfaces

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: The 1504 global definition of a vce as from MSO/SDN-C. In 1504, SDN-C will PUT this data and MSO will update it. In addition, A&AI will populate interface-name, v6-vce-wan-address, and ipv4-oam-address based on a RESTCONF call? In 1507, we hope to move to the newvce object, which may need a few more attributes. We need a discussion with MSO about orchestration vs. inventory.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique id of VNF. This is unique across the graph.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Name of VNF.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Alternate name of VNF.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Type of VNF. Source of truth should define and socialize values. Becomes part of the key to service capability

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Trigger for operational monitoring of this resource by Service Assurance systems.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Indicator for whether the resource is considered operational

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: License key

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Client should send valid enumerated value

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Orchestration status of this VNF, used by MSO.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Heat stack id corresponding to this instance, managed by MSO

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Corresponds to the SDN-C catalog id used to configure this VCE

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique ID of VPE connected to this VCE.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Valid v6 IP address for the WAN Link on this router. Implied length of /64.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Address tail-f uses to configure vce, also used for troubleshooting and is IP used for traps generated by VCE.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique ID of the interface

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Neutron network id of this Interface

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Neutron network name of this Interface

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Role assigned to this Interface, should use values as defined in ECOMP Yang models.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique ID for port group in vmware

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Likely to duplicate value of neutron network name

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: DVS or standard switch name (should be non-null for port groups associated with DVS)

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Orchestration status of this VNF, used by MSO.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Heat stack id corresponding to this instance, managed by MSO

xml-property.value: See mis-na-virtualization-platform.yang

xml-property.value: Network ID, governed by some naming convention. Unique across A&AI.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: This is the skeleton of the new VCE object we hope to migrate to in 1507. In 1504, we will use it to store network data gathered from RESTCONF calls to SDN-C. The vnf-id2 leaf needs to be populated with the value of the vce's vnf-id.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Unique id of VNF, can't use same attribute name right now until we promote this new object

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Name of VNF.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Alternate name of VNF.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Type of VNF. Source of truth should define and socialize values. Becomes part of the key to service capability

xml-property.name: description

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Address tail-f uses to configure generic-vnf, also used for troubleshooting and is IP used for traps generated by GenericVnf (v4-loopback0-ip-address).

xml-property.value: Client should send valid enumerated value.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Orchestration status of this VNF, used by MSO.

xml-property.value: Aspirational VCE object which we'll use to capture additional interface details regarding topology.

xml-property.value: Trigger for operational monitoring of this VNF by BAU Service Assurance systems.

xml-property.name: description
xml-property.value: Address tail-f uses to configure generic-vnf, also used for troubleshooting and is IP used for traps generated by GenericVnf (v4-loopback0-ip-address).

xml-property.name: description

xml-property.name: description
